meanings.definition: A temporary reduction in electrical power
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the brownout caused the lights to flicker.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood experienced a brownout due to the power grid overload.
meanings.sent3: The brownout turned the TV off right before the climax of the movie.
meanings.sent4: The brownout cast a shadow over the city, plunging it into darkness.
meanings.sent5: I'll never forget the brownout that left us without electricity for hours.

meanings.definition: A dimming or reduction in brightness of lights
meanings.sent1: The brownout made the room look eerie with its dim lighting.
meanings.sent2: The brownout in the theater created a cozy atmosphere for the movie screening.
meanings.sent3: During the brownout, the nightlight barely illuminated the hallway.
meanings.sent4: The brownout turned the streetlights into faint glows in the distance.
meanings.sent5: I navigated the house carefully during the brownout to avoid tripping over things.

meanings.definition: A decrease in voltage in an electrical power supply
meanings.sent1: The brownout caused the appliances to run slower than usual.
meanings.sent2: The brownout affected the factory's production line by reducing voltage.
meanings.sent3: The brownout made the microwave take longer to heat up the food.
meanings.sent4: During the brownout, the computer struggled to function properly.
meanings.sent5: The brownout damaged some electronic devices due to the voltage drop.
